klook_title: Aura Art - Traditional Chinese Painting Workshop
klook_description: Join a traditional Chinese painting workshop, considered one of the oldest continuous artistic traditions in the world, and take your masterpiece home! Book a session through Klook for a hassle-free experience
klook_summary: Grab a brush and ink and try the art of Chinese painting! This art form will allow you to express your creativity, calm your mind, and allow you to appreciate the beauty of art and nature. Known as guÃ³ huÃ  or native painting, traditional Chinese painting is considered one of the oldest continuous artistic traditions in the world. It uses "Shui Mo" (water and ink), which is a freestyle technique created using a brush dipped in ink and water, and onto rice paper. During this hour and a half lesson, you'll learn different brush strokes, as well as get a solid introduction to the oriental materials, tools, and the painting subject from a professional tutor. You can take your fabulous masterpiece home, serving as a great souvenir from your Hong Kong trip! This class is perfect for friends and family, and no previous experience is required.
klook_highlights: Experience one of the oldest continuous artistic traditions in the world: traditional Chinese painting!
Get a solid introduction to the materials tools, subjects, and brush strokes from a professional tutor
Take your masterpiece home! This will serve as a great souvenir from your unforgettable Hong Kong trip
You don't need to have an artist's hands. This class is perfect for beginners and skillful artists alike

klook_title: [Hot choice in summer] Twilight Art Studio - Indigo dyeing · Traditional plant printing and dyeing workshop
klook_description: In this indigo dyeing course, you can not only experience the fun of indigo dyeing, but also take away the indigo dyeing works you made with your own hands! Each person includes a T-shirt and an optional item (handbag/pillowcase), a total of two items per person. The workshop teaches you how to use different tie-dye and batik techniques to dye your own unique works. Please refer to Klook website for details.
klook_summary:
Course details
Time: about 2 hours
Location: Lai Chi Kok
Fee: $350/person
*Number of people: Maximum 16 people
This course:
No indigo dyeing experience required
Anyone who is interested in Aizen
Things to note:
*A class lasts about 2 hours. Due to the compact nature of the course, participants are asked to arrive on time.
*If strong wind signal No. 8 or above is hoisted 3 hours before class; or the black rainstorm warning signal is in effect, the activity will be rescheduled
klook_highlights: Only one blue seems very boring? In fact, the ancient traditional craft of indigo dyeing is ever-changing. In addition to the depth of color, you can also create your own unique design through different shapes!

Indigo dyeing is a natural plant dyeing technology with a history of more than 2,000 years. In this indigo dyeing course, you can not only experience the fun of indigo dyeing, but also take away the indigo dyeing works you made with your own hands!

Each person includes a T-shirt and an optional item (handbag/pillowcase), a total of two items per person. The workshop teaches you how to use different tie-dye and batik techniques to dye your own unique works.
*The cost includes materials and tools. The course is relaxed and simple, and you can easily enjoy the entire production process.

No indigo dyeing experience is required to participate in the course. The instructor will explain the process carefully and teach you different indigo dyeing techniques. Even friends who have never done it before can participate. Please sign up to experience it now!

klook_summary: Come to the quiet island of Ma Wan 1868, and you will personally turn an old coin into a special commemorative ring. No experience is required. klook_title: Aura Art - Seal Carving Workshop | Central
klook_description: Try your hand at seal carving in this workshop by Aura Art! Learn more about China's ancient history through a step-by-step process of the traditional art form. Get discounts when you book through Klook!
klook_summary: Back in the old days of China, seals were symbols of authority and power. These pocket-size stamps were used exclusively by the government to signify the importance of a document and the owner. Only the most talented craftsmen were trained to carve intricate Chinese characters into seals, a specialization that built seal carving schools throughout the country. But today, the once mysterious traditional art form can now be learned through an hour-long workshop at Aura Art in Hong Kong. Gain basic skills with the help of an expert tutor in just a short amount of time and be able to create your own right after the class. Learn the use of each and every tool laid out on your table - all of which you can use for as long as you want. Follow a simple pattern on a sample by watching your tutor's step-by-step demonstration. Once you get the hang of it, you can now chisel away and recreate a Chinese character you like. End the class with your finished product that will serve well as a great souvenir of your Hong Kong trip. Join the workshop now through Klook!
klook_highlights: Try your hand at seal carving with this workshop by Aura Art!
Learn more about the traditional art of seal carving as you follow your expert tutor's lead
Personalize your handmade stamp by carving a unique Chinese character that represents you
Take your stamp back home as a souvenir or use it as your new signature for letters
Check out other traditional art workshops, such as Chinese Painting, Printmaking, Neon Light Art or Mosaic Art

klook_title: Aura Art® - Printmaking Art Workshop | Causeway Bay
klook_description: Bring your creative ideas to life with a printmaking art workshop in Hong Kong. You'll leave this 1.5 hour workshop with knowledge and a one-of-a-kind souvenir. Visit Klook for more information.
klook_summary: Venture into the exciting world of printmaking in an hour and a half printmaking art workshop. Printmaking is a unique and beautiful art form that's not well understood outside the art world, despite having been around for thousands of years since the invention of paper. This involves transferring an image from a plate or block to a piece of paper, usually with the intention of making multiple identical copies. And with this art workshop, you can try your hand at printmaking as you follow the lead of an English-speaking printmaking master. Come as you are, because all the tools and materials you need are already here. You'll leave this session with new knowledge—and a one-of-a-kind souvenir!
klook_highlights: Bring out your inner artist in this hour and a half printmaking art workshop!
Use blocks and paper as your springboard for ideas, as this hands-on workshop encourages experimenting with prints
Learn from the best, with an English-speaking teacher with years of printmaking experience
Leave the class with a one-of-a-kind souvenir that you can keep or give as a gift to friends!

klook_title: Nagomi Pastel Art Trial Workshop at JCCAC
klook_description: Book this Nagomi Pastel Art Trial Workshop and get great discounts here!
klook_highlights: Nagomi Art, a form of Japanese art healing founded in Japan, using pastels and fingers to create a gentle, transparent, warm, and heart-touching art through simple yet unique ways of painting techniques.
The therapeutic nature of this art is able to create a sense of harmony and enhance the self-esteem of the painter.

This art helps to calm and relax one’s mind as the painters go through the process to choose and blend the colors and complete the beautiful art piece all by themselves. It’s an art for everyone and anyone!
Duration: Approx. 2 hours (1 to 2 Artworks can be done)
Venue: L625, 6/F Jockey Club Creative Arts Centre (JCCAC) 30 Pak Tin Street Shek Kip Mei Kowloon, Hong Kong
Date & Time: Please book 3 days prior to the actual workshop day
Price: $320 per person / $450 per 1 kid + 1 parent (6 years old or below) + 1 Parent

klook_description: Join workshops of Loveless Knots through Klook. Make your own handcraft now and enjoy special discounts! Loveless Knots provides Macrame Phone Strap & Macrame Net Bag workshops. It’s time to transform your space with this bohemian vibe. Visit the Klook website for more information.
klook_summary: Macramé is a form of fiber art which is unlike crochet or knitting, it is done without tools but by knotting with hands. Its rich history can be dated back centuries when ancients used decorative knots to secure the excess thread of woven pieces. It peaked high popularity in Victorian period and Queen Mary even taught her ladies-in-waiting macrame class! You can find many macramé decoration on fashion, curtains, tablecloths from that period. Now, macramé is making a huge return, let’s bring home with your unique piece with this historic knotting techniques. **Suitable for age above 11**
klook_highlights: Pick the color which speaks to you and create your unique art piece

klook_title: Ceramic Experience Workshop by Useless Studio Hong Kong
klook_description: Join workshops of Useless Studio through Klook. Make your own handcraft now and enjoy special discounts! Hand-building is the most traditional technique in the history of ceramic art. In the experience, you will travel back to the origin of clay art, and practice the most essential, important & fundamental pottery techniques while creating your own unique ceramic piece.
klook_summary: The very first step of wheel throwing practice is getting to know the clay, and shaping it with the help of the spinning wheel. In this trial class, you will get to experience the foundation of the entire wheel throwing art. This class is designed for beginners who are interested in ceramic art. This price has included all the materials, firing, trimming & glazing fee for one product.
klook_highlights: Make the most unique ceramic ware with your own hands.
Hear the stories behind daily wares and learn how to appreciate a piece of ceramic artwork.
Class themes include wheel-throwing trial class, hand-build ceramic cup / bowl / plate / coffee dripper / sake set.
Wheel-throwing trial workshop fee has included post-production fee. Students can top-up during the class for glazing experience.
The hand-build experience workshop fee will cover 2 classes: Class 1 - Shaping; Class 2 - Glazing.
In the class, you will get to learn the basic techniques of creating a hand-built ceramic piece, you will get to experience how the chemistry works together between clay & glaze.

Each theme will have 2 classes in total. Class 1 - shaping, class 2 - glazing. You only need to select the class time for your first class, we will contact you to book the second class after your works finish firing.
Hand-build ceramic cup / mug workshop: Shaping your work with a clay slab, you will get to experience the connection between clay & time/water.
Hand-build ceramic plate workshop: There are different techniques you may use to hand-build a ceramic plate. Plaster casting is one of the most popular methods in the industry.
Hand-build ceramic bowl workshop: Using the hand-build technique to build a ceramic bowl, can give a unique texture.

Hand-build ceramic coffee dripper workshop: The ceramic coffee dripper is considered the best material for hand brewing, as ceramics keep the water temperature well during the processes, and could maintain a balanced flavor for hand-brew coffee.
Hand-build ceramic sake set workshop: In traditional eastern culture, you should choose the right ware for the right food or drink, in order to show your respect for nature.

klook_description: This is a printing technique that releases the natural pigments of plants. We will use recycled plants to dye fabrics in the workshop, learn to save the color and form of plants. Allow to enjoy the fun of being in contact with nature.
klook_summary: Botanical Printing Workshop. Cyanotype Workshop. Participants will get to know different plants in Hong Kong, to experience the process of natural printing and dyeing, create your own dyes.
klook_highlights: A studio uses different techniques to create textile art and combine it with fashion.
Textile art like wool felting and botanical printing wander between "failure" and "satisfying" results, and we are drawn to the aesthetics in mistakes!
With A Studio, you could create your own graphics or pattern on clothes, bags, shoes, hats, scarf, just to name a few!
You can print your lovely pet using the cyanotype printing techniques and make a unique T-shirt for yourself, or even wool felt a nice scarf as a gift to your loved one.

Cyanotype originated in the 18th century. This method can copy the data on the negative film to the paper one by one, we can also use cyanotype to create our own T-shirt, post card or tote bag, in addition to paper.

klook_title: Handmade Classroom – Popular Tufting Carpet Workshop
klook_description: Hurry and make an appointment at the “Handmade Classroom” in Causeway Bay to make your own or your little one’s unique carpet!
klook_summary: Event date: Monday to Wednesday, Friday to Sunday 11am - 6pm (please contact the studio to confirm the time and pattern after purchasing the event). Activity time: approximately 4 - 8 hours (depending on the size and complexity of the work). Whatsapp inquiry: 97899264. Address: Room J, 4/F, Po Ming Building, 2-6 Fu Ming Street, Causeway Bay. Take buses from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island: 108, 117 (alight at Lee Theater Station), 102, 112, 116 (alight at Soi Kwong Department Store Station). Take the MTR to Causeway Bay Station, take Exit F1 (Hysan Place), turn right and go up the small ramp to Kai Chiu Road, go straight to the end, turn left and go straight to Fu Ming Street to reach Po Ming Building. The whole journey takes about 3 minutes.
klook_highlights: Hurry and make an appointment at the “Handmade Classroom” in Causeway Bay to make your own or your little one’s unique carpet!
Each e-ticket only provides 1 seat. Children under 13 years old must be accompanied by an adult to make the production, and the accompanying person does not need to purchase a ticket.
All workshops are for one person using one machine and only one frame. If you want to share it with two people (two people using one machine to produce one work), it will cost +$150.
Post-production takes about 1-2 weeks. After completion, you can choose to pay by SF Express or pick it up at the studio.
If it cannot be completed within the time limit, you can choose to complete the work overtime or have the staff complete the remaining part.
Overtime: $150/hour; completed works: $200/piece
Please arrive at the studio on time. If you are late for more than 30 minutes, you will give up your seat. If there are special circumstances, please contact the studio for enquiry.
Typhoon No. 1, 3 or Red and Black Rain studios will operate as usual. Typhoon No. 8 signals can be rescheduled by contacting the studio.

klook_title: IRREGULart - Creative tie-dye workshop
klook_description: IRREGULart provides square towels, pencil cases, long bags, T-shirts, canvas bags, backpacks, neck scarves, pillow cases, etc. to choose from. In addition, students can also bring their own tie-dyed items and bring them to class to change them. New shapes can give a second life, or use some simple techniques to restore the popularity of meaningful old items, improve their memory, and add meaning to environmentally-themed creations. Students complete everything from material selection to design by themselves, and finally take the completed work home, adding a sense of ritual to life.
klook_summary: Tie-dye has a long history. Originated from the Yellow River Basin. It is still uncertain when it originated. According to records, as early as the Eastern Jin Dynasty, knotted and anti-dyed twisted valerian silk had been produced in large quantities. Tie-dyeing generally uses cotton white cloth or cotton-linen blended white cloth as raw material. The tie-dying process is divided into two parts: tying and dyeing.

We located in Kwai Hing, offering a wide range of Tufting courses and custom services, encouraging you to choose the perfect class based on your preferred design and desired duration. Our goal is to create a space where entertainment and art intertwine. So why not free up a few hours and join us for a healing and stress-relieving new adventure?

We believe that Tufting is not just about creating a piece of art; it's a process of turning imagination into reality. From selecting patterns to color coordination and even the finishing touches, you have unlimited freedom to express your creativity.
Rest assured and leave the design to us! THEFLOORISCOLD STUDIO will work alongside you to craft unique and imaginative artworks.

Please WhatApp your selected image to 9823 0557 at least 1 day before the class. If you encounter any problems in selecting the image, you shall contact us and our instructor will give you suggestions based on the difficulty of your pattern!
LET'S MAKE IT BE REAL.

enrich_textEmbedding: Join the Moss Jade Workshop at myosotis flower in Kwun Tong to learn the art of creating Kokedama plant spheres. This hands-on session teaches how to use moss, sphagnum moss, and soil to form self-watering plant pots that reduce root rot risks. The workshop lasts two hours and transforms traditional potted plants into portable, low-maintenance green spheres ideal for home or office decor. Participants will gain practical skills in bundling plants with moss and maintaining their health through weekly soaking and moisture control.
enrich_description: Create self-watering moss plant spheres in a 2-hour workshop at myosotis flower in Kwun Tong.

klook_title: URBANPEACE - Korean Wool Doll Workshop
klook_description: Book URBANPEACE - Korean Wool Doll Workshop at a discounted price through Klook and experience Korean wool doll making firsthand.
klook_summary: It is very suitable for activities for parents and children, girlfriends, couples, and office workers. You can make your own plush doll without needlework. The plush feel makes people fall in love with it. First, use a plush twisting stick to twist the doll shape, then trim the plush, choose the color of the doll, add eyes and nose, and match it with your favorite clothes and accessories. It is 100% personalized. We provide twist sticks in a variety of colors, and you can match them with clothes and accessories, which will definitely satisfy everyone’s desire to dress up!
klook_highlights: Introducing South Korea's CCA's most popular plush doll, Moru Doll, you can easily create your own unique plush doll without needlework, and you can also put clothes and accessories on the doll, which is a super healing process. In addition to being used as a decoration, it can also be made into a keychain or a mobile phone lanyard. It is really super cute!

Course content: Step 1: First select the fur color and animal Optional: (choose 1 from 4) Dog/Cat/Bear/Rabbit Step 2: After making the doll, assemble the facial features Step 3: Match your favorite OOTD Offers a variety of clothing and accessories
For two people to create one work, an additional $100 will be charged *The above fees include materials, tools and instructor fees
After successful payment and registration, our store will contact you as soon as possible to confirm the workshop time *Production time will vary depending on individual speed
This workshop is non-refundable

PERLER BEADS DIY Workshop: PERLER BEADS (Pinpin Doudou) has been established for more than 25 years. Its products are not only a famous educational toy brand in the United States, but also a pioneer in international educational toys. Today, PERLER BEADS (Pinpin Doudou) has become popular in China. , Australia, Canada, Japan, South Korea and more than 20 countries, it has become an indispensable educational puzzle toy for children. PERLER BEADS has no age limit, but has unlimited creative space. It can be imperfect. Stick to the constraints of the template and use your imagination and creativity at will. Any pattern you like can become your work. Whether it is given to relatives and friends or kept for yourself, it is a precious gift. Glass Painting Lamp Workshop: Taking advantage of the transparency of glass, glass paint is used to depict landscapes, flowers and birds, auspicious patterns, etc., with bright and strong colors. klook_title: Russian Nesting Doll (Matryoshka) Workshop, Hong Kong
klook_description: Create your own Russian doll right in the heart of Hong Kong with this workshop! Choose a character and handpaint the body with tools from Aura Art. Get discounts on the workshop when you book through Klook!
klook_summary: Hong Kong is a melting pot of cultures, which is why it's no surprise that even the Russian nesting doll has made its way to the bustling metropolis. Known as 'matryoshka' in its motherland, this folk toy is a set of wooden dolls fitted inside each other in a descending order. Each doll follows a theme - may it be political, a slice of life, or even pop culture. Try your hand at traditional Russian nesting doll-making with this workshop by Aura Art. Head over their studio in Central and be greeted by a friendly multilingual tutor. A short briefing will ensue and samples will be given as your guide throughout the class. Follow the tutor's step-by-step process for better results but feel free to have your way with your own set of dolls. Play around with colors and tools as you create a theme that personally interests you or speaks of your personality. Make sure to take home your finished set as souvenir - an interesting home decor with Russian origins, yet filled with memories of Hong Kong. Capture this intercultural experience in adorable wooden pieces when you book this workshop through Klook!
klook_highlights: Learn how to paint Russian nesting dolls in less than two hours with this workshop!
Create your own theme or be inspired by your favorite characters from movies, cartoons, or TV shows
Feel at ease during the class as your expert tutor guides your group throughout the entire workshop
Show off your matryoshka doll's handpainted details and expressions to loved ones back home
Try other traditional art workshops, such as Chinese Painting, Printmaking, Neon Light Art, or Mosaic Art

klook_title: Craft Sustainability: Exclusive $100 Cashback on 1-hour Food Waste Jewelry Workshop by Ways Out
klook_description: Join Ways Out for a unique 1-hour Food Waste Jewelry Workshop and receive an exclusive $100 cashback. Dive into sustainable crafting, create eco-friendly jewelry from food waste, and embrace creativity with purpose. Unleash your artistic side while making a positive impact on the environment.
klook_summary: Can kitchen waste be turned into jewelry? That’s right, as long as you use some creativity with us, some “worthless” fruit peels or vegetable heads and ends can be turned into exquisite jewelry! Original jewelry, the only one in Hong Kong: Experience the upcycling of “waste to treasure” and make a unique kitchen waste jewelry to give a special gift to yourself or your loved ones. Multiple designs and colors: Each person can make a bracelet/necklace, or a pair of earrings; a variety of “kitchen waste gems” colors are available. Age-friendly, no hand-crafting experience required: Suitable for children (10+ years old), seniors, couples, sisters, girlfriends, families; private classes are available (8 people). Up to $100 cashback: Leave a Klook review on-site after completing the experience to enjoy a $50 cash back; complete the task on the designated mobile platform afterwards to enjoy another $50 cash back. Environmentally friendly production process: Reusable tools and environmentally friendly recycled materials are used throughout the process, and disposable utensils are firmly rejected. Support local social enterprises and sustainable development: Ways Out HK promotes environmental sustainability education through kitchen waste jewellery and supports young single mothers by providing them with employment and on-the-job training opportunities. Time: Every Saturday; 3 sessions per day: 11am - 12pm, 1pm - 2pm, 3pm - 4.30pm. Location: Room 38, 4/F, Po Yip Building, 23 Hing Yip Street, Kwun Tong. Finish product: Each person can make a bracelet/necklace, or a pair of earrings; “kitchen waste gems” colors include red, pink, green, black, and yellow.

klook_title: [Exclusive] Coco & the Sun Fitness Class Experience
klook_description: Enjoy more than 30% off for 3 fitness classes, featuring 5 different types of classes: HIIT, Mat Pilates, Zumba, Full body Sculpt & Barre. Instructors Coco & Nat will give you a very unique workout experience.
klook_summary:
Class Descriptions:
1. Full-Body Sculpting
Sculpt and tone your entire body with high-frequency, low-impact exercises. Target your arms, thighs, and especially your glutes and abdomen. Experience the burning sensation and muscle tremors as you work out!
2. High-Intensity Cardio + Pilates
The first half of the class consists of high-intensity exercises with short rest periods, creating a calorie-burning effect and strengthening your core muscles. The second half focuses on Pilates exercises on the mat, targeting deep muscles, correcting body posture, and emphasizing control of the core muscle group.
3. Barre Workout
Barre is a popular body-shaping exercise derived from the US. It combines elements of ballet, Pilates, yoga, and incorporates equipment such as resistance balls, resistance bands, and dumbbells. Through high-frequency, low-impact movements, this workout effectively trains every muscle group in your body, enhances stability and control of your core muscles, sculpts your body lines, boosts metabolism, and improves body alignment.

klook_title: MEMORIES CERAMIC HK - Ceramic Hand-painted Glaze Workshop | Sheung Wan
klook_description:
#MEMORIES CERAMIC HK
Containers made of clay can maintain temperature for a longer period of time, and their unique feel can give people a unique feeling. This unforgettable memory will be retained forever…
klook_summary:
#MEMORIES CERAMIC HK
Containers made of clay can maintain temperature for a longer period of time, and their unique feel can give people a unique feeling. This unforgettable memory will be retained forever…
In recent years, fire-free ceramics have become very popular in Japan and Taiwan. There is no need to use a kiln for firing. The work can have the same effect as ceramics through natural air drying, reducing the risk of cracking during the firing process, and creating ceramic works of art safely and easily. Welcome Handicraft workshops for parents and children, individuals, couples and groups of friends.
Techniques for making hand-kneaded clay
*Professor’s hand-made production: decorative plate/cartoon doll/food display/chopstick holder
*Teaching how to paint patterns or embossing on non-fired ceramics
Instruction on how to use colors and gloss glaze techniques (12 colors for students to choose from)
*Students make two works by themselves. If you want to purchase one more work, you can choose a mooncake-shaped decoration for $80 each.
2 hours (including all materials, paints, ceramic tools, aprons and tutor fees)
Works can be retrieved immediately after completion
Workshop time: 2 hours
Fee: $395/person 5 days before the event | Please note that the price is subject to availability

klook_description: Jelly Flower: An edible art. Imagine a crystal clear flower frozen in time with colorful gradients. Each student creates 3 mini jelly flowers in a small class setting in Kwun Tong, with sessions at 9:30, 14:30, and 19:30 daily.
klook_summary: Jelly Flower: An edible art. Ever thought you could eat a beautiful flower and not feel the bitter taste? Not only do jelly flowers make this dream come true, they also add a stunning pop of color to your table! Imagine a crystal clear flower, frozen in time as if by magic. Each petal is like a carefully carved gem, shining with charming luster in the light. They can be a single color or a multicolored gradient, like a living watercolor painting. This is not just a dessert, but an artistic experience. When you taste jelly flowers, you are not only enjoying delicious food, but also appreciating a beautiful piece of art. It will become the focus of your dining table and add a splash of color to your life. Are you ready to embark on a delicious art journey? Come and experience how to make jelly flowers now, a feast for your taste buds and eyes at the same time! Classes start at 9:30, 14:30 & 19:30 every day. There are only 6 places in each class - Each student will complete 3 mini jelly flowers.

klook_title: JUST BE Art Jamming【Exclusive free Little Flow Bear Workshop】—Ma Wan Art Village, Hong Kong
klook_description: Explore the JUST BE Art and Culture Workshop located in Ma Wan Art Village, Tsim Sha Tsui, and Kwai Chung. Through rich and diversified art courses, it allows students to demonstrate their creativity and expression skills.
klook_summary: JUST BE (Art and Culture Workshop) is located in the Art Village at Ma Wan 1868, Tsim Sha Tsui and Kwai Chung. Through rich and diversified art courses, it allows students to demonstrate their creativity and expression skills. It is very popular among parents and children, couples, friends gatherings, birthday celebrations, schools, companies and organizations. JUST BE Art and Culture Workshop includes: Color tie-dyeing | Turkish mosaic lamp | Turkish coffee experience | Art jamming | Fluid painting | Glass colored night light | Floating vase | Environmental art | TUFTING | Neon light cold light art | Bean puzzle | Film photography and printing | Hanfu | Chinese painting | Fashion design | Makeup course | Painting course | Ink painting course | Watercolor course | Handicraft workshop | Paper art | Weaving | Parent-child workshop | STEM course | Electronic keyboard | Handpan | Guitar | Hawaiian guitar | Indian accordion | Indian midanga drum | Floating vase | Intangible cultural heritage floating lacquer fan | Outreach service | Tailor-made | Door-to-door service | Parent-child mini chef | Artisan coffee baking | Delicious cookies | Special cheesecake. When you come to the Art Village in Ma Wan, which combines natural ecological environment, art, historical and cultural elements, you can experience JUST BE art activities. There are also Noah’s Ark and beaches, special outdoor activity venues such as wild camps and leisure farms, as well as retail and dining venues nearby. It has become diversified and injected colorful into public life. It is very suitable for everyone to come for a day trip to relax their body and mind. JUST BE in the moment “live in the present” to feel everything in the present, focus on the experience in front of you, and savor the small beauty in life. Let’s encourage each other!
klook_highlights: JUST BE Art Jamming【Exclusive free Little Flow Bear Workshop】—Ma Wan Art Village, Hong Kong
Art Jamming is an art-making activity in which students work together to create art in a relaxed, fun environment and share their creations with others.
Art Jamming originated in the United States in the early 20th century and became a popular art and cultural activity in Asia, especially in Hong Kong and Singapore.
IRREGULart provides a space, canvases, brushes, and other supplies for students to create their own works of art with no experience required.
Art Jamming is particularly suitable for friends, couples, families, and parent-child workshops to enhance relationships.

klook_title: Atarox Studios Silver Smith Workshop Ring Earrings Pendant
klook_description: Experience the art of silversmithing with a workshop in Hong Kong. Craft your own unique jewelry with expert guidance.
klook_summary: In this workshop from Atarox Studios, you can create stunning jewelry items like rings, earrings, and pendants. The session covers traditional metalworking techniques including cutting, filing, welding, and polishing. Perfect for beginners, no experience is required, and all materials are provided. Make a personalized item for yourself or someone special.
klook_highlights: We provide a variety of special workshops: from rings, earrings, bracelets to life furnishings, you can make them yourself.
We will teach you how to gradually create unique jewelry from silver.

Participants will experience various traditional metalworking skills: such as wire saw cutting, filing, welding, forging, inlaying, pickling, use of polishing machines, etc. It's more than just typing letters.
No metalworking or manual work experience is required; novices can easily master it.

If you need to customize some details of your work, discuss this with your instructor.*The workshop is held in a small group. Whether you are with friends or loved ones, or making a quality gift alone, there is absolutely no problem!

klook_title: Mother-of-pearl Inlay Workshop in Hong Kong
klook_description: Bring the rainbow of shells home
klook_summary: Mother-of-pearl inlay is a traditional decorative technique that originated in China's Shang Dynasty. It uses the iridescent material of the inner layer of shells to inlay on the surface of objects, creating a colorful visual effect. Its craftsmanship carries the Eastern philosophy of "harmony between man and nature", showing both the spirituality of natural materials and the craftsmen's ultimate pursuit of details.
klook_highlights: Culture and craftsmanship: Experience traditional Chinese culture, learn about the historical origins of mother-of-pearl, the characteristics of its materials (such as the selection of luminous shells and pearl shells), and the inlay techniques, and understand its artistic language of "using shells as ink".
Hands-on experience: Participate in the craftsmanship from shell selection, design to inlaying.
Take away unique pieces: Finished products such as butterfly brooches and bracelets are both artistic and practical, suitable as gifts or personal collections.
Recommended for couples and besties: Make accessories for each other yourself (more classy than couple outfits!).
Welcome corporate teambuilding or organization appointments, please WhatsApp us for corporate discounts

klook_title: Hong Kong Cat Cafe - Cats Tea Room Mongkok Tsim Sha Tsui Tsuen Wan
klook_description: The Cats Tea Room, a cat cafe in Hong Kong, opened in 2014 and has branches in Tsuen Wan, Tsim Sha Tsui, and Mong Kok. The locations are very convenient, close to MTR stations, and only a few minutes' walk away.
klook_summary: The Cats Tea Room, a Hong Kong cat cafe, offers a unique experience to interact with adorable cats in their spacious facilities. Originally opened in 2014, this cat cafe now operates three branches in popular areas, providing drinks, light snacks, and board games for customers. The initial purpose of the cafe is to provide a comfortable and warm home for stray cats, and all the cats in both Mong Kok and Tsim Sha Tsui branches are adopted. After closing hours, the cats are free to roam and the cafe provides them with food, sleeping mats, warm water bags, and cat toys. Also, the cafe offers cat adoption services.
klook_highlights: A Hong Kong cat cafe with branches in Tsuen Wan, Tsim Sha Tsui, and Mong Kok offering cat interaction and adopted cat care facilities
Offers drinks, light snacks, and board games for customers in a cat-friendly environment
Half of the cats in the original Tsuen Wan branch are adopted while all cats in Mong Kok and Tsim Sha Tsui branches are available for adoption

klook_title: Float Co. HK Spa Experience (Float On Hong Kong)
klook_description: Try the float therapy at Float Co. (Float On Hong Kong) to experience the therapeutic benefits of sensory deprivation. Book Float HK spa here for great deals!
klook_summary: Floating sessions have become rapidly popular all over the world for its therapeutic benefits. Scientific studies have shown that there is something extremely soothing about being able to float in the water in perfect peace, silence, and isolation, calling back to how infants calmly floated during gestation, away from the stresses of the world. Floating pods have come to Hong Kong, allowing you to experience a 60-minute of tranquility within the pod. A perfect escape from the stress and fast paced life of the city. The complete calm and zero-gravity environment offers you the ability to let go of the world while in a peaceful isolation. First timers need not worry as there will be a orientation before each guest enters the pod. After the therapy, you'll find yourself emerging splendidly relaxed from the pod. Regular cold plunge sessions can help you achieve all these benefits and more. Join us at Float Co and take the plunge into cold water therapy. Experience the ultimate challenge for your body and mind, and discover the powerful wellness treatment that is changing the game. Are you ready to dive in?
klook_highlights: Experience at Hong Kong’s first sensory deprivation centre in Float Co.
Experience complete silence and tranquility when you try the floating pod that mimics a zero gravity environment
Float Co. in Hong Kong is one of the best places in the city to loosen up and relax
Cocooned within the DreamPods, your body becomes weightless and your muscles begins to relax
Feel completely relaxed as you enter one of the float tanks and destress from all the noise of the busy city

Experience Cold plunge - Step into our 5-7 degrees cold barrel and experience the incredible benefits of cold plunge at Float Co. This is a chance for you to test yourself and go beyond your limits for your health and longevity.

Crystal singing bowl audio therapy helps to perceive self-awareness and explore life in multiple dimensions
With my personal meditation guidance, singing bowls and musical instruments, it is like a concert of body, mind and soul
The vibration and resonance of the crystal bowl help the body rest, relax and heal
Clear negative energy, relieve emotions and stress, improve blood circulation, balance chakras

klook_title: Autocamper | Luxury Glamping Experience
klook_description: Autocamper Hong Kong Luxury Glapming Experience
klook_summary: Originated in 1901, Nordisk was formerly a Danish company called Northern Feather, the first Danish company to focus entirely on Downs and feathers. In the 1960s, Nordisk began to set foot in the outdoor products market and became one of the leading outdoor brands in Europe. Today, Nordisk's beautiful white technology cotton tents have become the first choice for Glamping camps, and they are also popular with campers in Japan and other places outside Europe.

klook_title: Hong Kong Tung Lung Island Kayak Tour to Explore the Unique Cave Ecology
klook_description: Reward yourself with a unique kayaking experience in Hong Kong and head to Tung Lung Island! Book this kayaking tour via Klook and paddle through the island's beautiful caves and explore its stunning coastline.
klook_summary: Explore Hong Kong's Outlying Islands - Tung Lung Island's Secret Caves with a professional instructor. Kayaking to learn about Hong Kong's small island fishing villages, visit the Shuang Mun Sea Caves, and explore the fountain rock and other wonders. See the historical relics of stone carvings with a history of more than 100 years. The tour is mainly small, so you can check in and take photos more freely.
klook_highlights: Explore Hong Kong's Outlying Islands - Tung Lung Island's Secret Caves with a professional instructor
Kayaking to learn about Hong Kong's small island fishing villages, visit the Shuang Mun Sea Caves, and explore the fountain rock and other wonders
See the historical relics of stone carvings with a history of more than 100 years
Mainly small groups, it is suitable as a holiday leisure option to avoid the bustling downtown and crowds and explore another side of Hong Kong
Physical strength required:
For those who are prone to seasickness, it is recommended to get enough sleep the night before and take seasickness medicine 30 minutes before participating in the activity
Please bring your own heel and toe shoes to avoid being scratched by shells or stones
Please bring your own clothes for swimming and it is recommended to use physical sunscreen products to protect the ocean
Please bring your own waterproof phone case
Please bring your own waterproof backpack (carry your belongings)
Please bring your own drinking water, it is recommended to be more than 1.5L
Please bring your own change of clothes after the activity
Please follow the instructor's instructions to make the journey safer
The fee does not include insurance, please purchase it if necessary
Octopus card must have enough balance to purchase round-trip ferry tickets
The activity itinerary may be adjusted depending on the weather on the day
The cave exploration may change the itinerary due to sea conditions and wind
If there are any changes or postponements due to weather factors, we will notify you at 07:00 on the day of the event

klook_title: Sai Kung Green Egg Island Kayaking and Snorkeling Day Tour
klook_description: Use a canoe or a stand-up board to appreciate the natural ecology and geological wonders of Sai Kung waters. Enjoy a relaxing and unforgettable holiday for you and your family/friends! While enjoying the view you can also learn marine ecological knowledge, which is suitable for family members or friends to play together. Visit the Klook website for more information.
klook_summary: Luker Sports Club Kayak Snorkeling (Green Egg Island Secret Tour) Venue: No. 20, Small Hangkou > Green Egg Island > Niuwei Chau > Return (8 kilometers) Course equipment includes: canoes, paddles, life jackets, (excluding snorkeling equipment, you need to bring your own) It is recommended to bring: Snacks (wet food and easy to absorb) Please wear a long-sleeved swimsuit (Ladies who want to take a good picture can go to the island to remove the left long-sleeve first, and it is best to wear it to protect the skin during the rest of the time) Gloves Water (2 liters) Waterproof bag (phone, food should be well protected) Towel (you can wipe your body with water on the beach) Sunscreen / sun hat Windbreaker/Change of clothes Snorkeling equipment (need to bring your own) Put on water sports shoes (don't wear "slippers, sandals" to avoid being hurt by shells or broken glass on the shore)
klook_highlights: Use a canoe or a stand-up board to appreciate the natural ecology and geological wonders of Sai Kung waters

Enjoy a relaxing and unforgettable holiday for you and your family/friends! While enjoying the view you can also learn marine ecological knowledge, which is suitable for family members or friends to play together.
The water quality of Green Egg Island is particularly clear, and the water is clear and sandy. It is called Okinawa Island in Hong Kong, so it attracts many people to go canoeing.
In addition to playing canoes, many people come to snorkel specially. If you plan to go to Green Egg Island, you may wish to bring snorkeling equipment!

klook_title: Hong Kong Fisherman's Wharf | Fisherfolk Experience Centre Pier 6
klook_description: Discover Hong Kong's fishing heritage at Fisherfolk Experience Centre Pier 6. Immerse yourself in the vibrant atmosphere of Aberdeen Fish Dawn Market!
klook_summary: Pier Fishing Experience + Aberdeen 1773 | Audio-guided Boat Tour + Houseboat Visit. Gather at PIER 6 in Aberdeen Fishing Village, then board Jumbo sightseeing wooden boat. Listen to the audio guide as you pass by various iconic landmarks in the fishing village, including the Tai Pak Seafood Restaurant, the Aberdeen Boat Club, and traditional shipyards. Visit the former water dwelling “Aberdeen Floating Village,” gaining insights into the lives of fishermen. Experience a themed boat docked next to the pier (not for sailing), where you can use fish traps and bait. Immerse yourself in the daily life of fishermen while fishing quietly in the typhoon shelter, enjoying the sea breeze, the rhythm of fishing, and a moment of tranquility. Includes traditional local snack and drink, insurance.
klook_highlights: Pier Fishing Experience + Aberdeen 1773 | Audio-guided Boat Tour + Houseboat Visit
Aberdeen 1773 | Fish Market Seafood + Fish Market Seafood
Half-Day Southern District Island Tour | Green Fishing Experience + Fishing Village Discovery

klook_description: Reserve The Fullerton Spa treatment on Klook now
klook_summary: The Fullerton Spa is an urban oasis of serenity in a timelessly elegant with floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the panoramic views of South China Sea. Committed to providing the finest in sustainable luxury, quality and service, The Fullerton Spa presents a range of exceptional treatments and products co-curated with premium international skincare brands who share the same values – Bamford from the United Kingdom and Subtle Energies from Australia. All products used are formulated with sustainable, natural, vegan or organic ingredients with sustainable packaging to minimise waste and impact on the environment.

THE EXPLORERS Situated on ground level of The Fullerton Ocean Park Hotel Hong Kong, The Explorers is a 6,400-square-feet indoor kid-play zone featuring 7 unique padded play areas specially curated for kids aged 1 to 10.

THE EXPLORERS Set sail on an incredible adventure through Hong Kong’s most awe-inspiring natural wonders. Hop aboard our ship as we chart a course through the monumental rock formations of Hong Kong UNESCO Global Geopark, search for treasure at a pirate’s cave, and explore the sights and sounds of Tai Po Kau Nature Reserve, Shek O Beach and the Mai Po Wetlands before ending our voyage at the famous Cape D’Aguilar Lighthouse. Jump aboard!

klook_title: The Peninsula Hotel Spa-Massage & Spa Experience | VOYA 'Moon & Tides' Spa |Aroma Massage | Deep Massage | Tsim Sha Tsui
klook_description: The Peninsula Hotel Spa offers various SPA and massage packages, including exclusive "Moon and Tides" treatments in collaboration with Irish skincare brand VOYA, as well as distinctive massages like Swedish and aromatherapy to meet all your comfort and wellness needs. Reserve your massage experience at The Peninsula Hotel Spa in Hong Kong through Klook to view reviews, and enjoy discounted offers.
klook_summary: A serene oasis where guests can pursue harmony of mind, body, and spirit, our expansive 14-room spa offers a sumptuous menu of therapeutic treatments and relaxing rituals. Our highly trained therapists perform treatments using some of the world’s most exclusive and naturally sourced product lines – including Margy’s Monte Carlo and VOYA – in a soothingly designed environment featuring warm-toned marble, weathered wood, and pale woven textiles. Six deluxe treatment rooms have stunning views over Victoria Harbour; the singularly luxurious couples’ spa suite, boasting an enormous harbour-view whirlpool tub for two, offers a private “spa-within-a-spa” experience. All spa guests are free to enjoy amenities such as men’s and women’s relaxation rooms, hammam-style steam rooms, saunas, and special aromatherapy experience showers.
klook_highlights: The Peninsula Spa is the serene oasis of the city, where soothing ambiance and elegant surroundings create the perfect environment for ultimate relaxation and indulgence
VOYA ‘Moon and Tides’ Spa Experiences offer two sustainable spa treatments inspired by the cycles of the moon for body renewal and inner healing
Guests can enjoy a three-course poolside menu or the Peninsula Classic Afternoon Tea at The Lobby to savour exquisite dining experiences at The Peninsula Hong Kong on the day of treatment

klook_location.address: 7/F, The Peninsula Spa, The Peninsula Hong Kong, Salisbury Road, Kowloon Hong Kong

klook_title: L'Occitane Hotel Magical Experience & ECO Workshops in Admiralty
klook_description: Embark on a captivating 40 mins journey from Provence to Hong Kong.
klook_summary:
L'Occitane & Earth Element Upcycled Terrazzo Workshop
L'Occitane en Provence is proud to once again partner with local art studio Earth Element to host a terrazzo upcycling workshop. Using beauty empties collected from our customers in Hong Kong, we combine sustainability with artistic design to craft your own unique terrazzo creation.
Together, we are exploring the limitless possibilities of recycling and waste reduction through creativity and innovation.
Experience the art of terrazzo crafting and explore the aesthetic sustainability
Learn techniques such as injection molding, terrazzo crafting and polishing, create your own unique terrazoo tray
Step into the Soul Element Studio and indulge in an unparalleled aesthetic experience while unleashing your creativity
Workshop Fee: HK$380 (redeemable against L'Occitane en Provence regular-priced products*
Upon workshop completion, you will receive a complimentary L'Occitane en Provence Almond Body Care Travel Kit (Almond Shower Oil 35ml and Almond Milk Concentrate 20ml)

klook_title: Hariky House - Traditional Thai Massage Experience
klook_description: Located in City One of Sha Tin, our massage centre offers a peaceful retreat away from the hustle and bustle of the city center. While not situated in the heart of the city, transportation is convenient with the nearby City One MTR Station, allowing easy access to our location within an hour from most areas. Our masseurs are highly skilled Thai therapists with over 20 years of experience. They provide authentic techniques that effectively alleviate pain, relax deep muscle tissues, and promote overall physical and mental well-being. With a spacious area of approximately 1,500 square feet, our massage centre features well-appointed double rooms adorned with Thai-style décor, creating an ambiance reminiscent of being in Thailand. After the massage session, we offer tea and Thai pastries for guests to indulge in, allowing them to fully immerse themselves in a leisurely experience. In addition to massage services, we also provide steam treatments. The lounge area offers comfortable seating where guests can enjoy a foot steam session with friends, and a 100-inch projector screen provides visual entertainment for guests to enjoy during their treatment
klook_summary: Traditional Thai massage experience in Sha Tin, Hong Kong
